- enhanced monitoring: self-monitoring of blood pressure, consultation every 10 days or so, regular biological check-up, monthly ultrasound scan

- a "Pregnancy and hypertension" follow-up booklet to optimise the care pathway between the various healthcare professionals involved in follow-up

- at 9 months, the possibility of artificially inducing labour depending on obstetric conditions.

question.question: Which of the following is a recommended practice for monitoring a pregnant woman with gestational hypertension (HTAg)?
question.option_a: Daily self-monitoring of blood pressure and consultation every 5 days
question.option_b: Monthly self-monitoring of blood pressure and consultation every 30 days
question.option_c: Self-monitoring of blood pressure, consultation every 10 days, regular biological check-up, and monthly ultrasound scan
question.option_d: Weekly self-monitoring of blood pressure and consultation every 7 days
